PtIncident.Summary: Disruption through Bury St Edmunds expected until 14:00
PtIncident.Description:
A speed restriction over a defective track at Bury St Edmunds means some lines are blocked. As a result, trains running through this station may be cancelled or revised. 

Disruption is expected until 14:00. 

Alternative travel advice:

Passengers travelling to Cambridge are advised to travel via Norwich. 

Tickets will be accepted on the following routes:

  • Great Northern between Cambridge and Ely

  • CrossCountry between Cambridge and Peterborough

  • East Midlands Railway between Norwich and Peterborough

 

A limited rail replacement bus service is in operation, however, customers are advised to travel via alternative rail routes where possible. 

Passengers travelling to Kennett should use the help point at stations to arrange onward travel. 

Check before you travel:
You can check your journey using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your replacement bus by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Twitter:
If you would like to follow this incident on Twitter, please use #BuryStEdmunds

Compensation:
You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey today. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Between Harwich International and Cambridge, and between Ipswich and Peterborough

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Oxford and Hanborough until the end of the day on Tuesday 21 February
PtIncident.Description:
A landslip in the Hanborough area is causing disruption to trains between Oxford and Worcester Shrub Hill.

Presently, trains are unable to run between Hanborough and Oxford. Road transport is running between these stations.

Trains on this route are able to run between Worcester Shrub Hill and Hanborough, and between Oxford and London Paddington.

Please check immediately before you travel.

Disruption is expected until the end of the day on Tuesday 21 February.

Customer Advice

To assist you with your journey your ticket will be accepted on the following services

  • CrossCountry between Reading and Birmingham New Street via Oxford
  • Chiltern Railways between London Marylebone and Oxford / Banbury / Birmingham Moor Street
  • Avanti West Coast between London Euston and Birmingham New Street
  • West Midlands Railway between Hereford / Great Malvern / Worcester and Birmingham Moor Street
  • Transport for Wales between Newport (South Wales) and Hereford

 

Rail Replacement Information:

Replacement road transport is in operation between Oxford and Hanborough in both directions until further notice.

Passengers from Worcester stations, Pershore, Evesham, Honeybourne or Moreton-in-Marsh travelling to Oxford, Reading or London Paddington are advised to travel to Hanborough and then alight there and await the onward rail replacement coach service to Oxford.

Passengers from London Paddington, Reading and Oxford for Moreton-in Marsh, Honeybourne, Evesham, Worcester stations and beyond are advised to travel to Oxford, change there for the rail replacement coach service to Hanborough and then await the onwards Great Western Railway train services to Worcester stations.

If you are travelling from Shipton, Ascott-under-Wychwood, Finstock and Combe, please use the Customer Help Point.

Rail replacement coaches do not serve Charlbury station, as there is a load restriction on a local bridge. The rail replacement coach service calls at Nine Acres Lane, Charlbury Village, which is a 10/15 minute walk from the station.

Please be advised the buses are currently operating as a shuttle service therefore there isn't a set timetable to which they are running although GWR are attempting to operate them as close the rail timetable as possible. If travelling from an unstaffed station, please trigger one of the available help-points located on platform level.

Check before you travel:
Journey planners are updated each night for the following days services, you can check these journeys using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your replacement bus by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Twitter:
If you would like to follow this incident on Twitter, please use #Hanborough

Compensation:
You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey today. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Between Oxford and Evesham, also between London Paddington and Hereford / Worcester Foregate Street

PtIncident.Summary: Disruption between London Waterloo and Basingstoke expected until the end of Thursday 23 February
PtIncident.Description:
A landslip in the Hook area on Saturday 14 January has closed two of the four lines between Woking and Basingstoke, causing disruption to train services.

Network Rail intend to fully complete the repairs to the line by the end of service on Thursday 23 February.

Customer Advice:

Until Friday 17 February:

A reduced service is operating between Woking and Basingstoke.

Also, in order to get the repairs completed, engineers will require more access to the railway between Farnborough and Basingstoke overnight. Normally the last service to run between these stations is at around 01:00, but to give engineers the time they need, services will now have to end by 22:20. Please check whether your journey is possible by using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner. 

Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February:

On Sunday morning, engineers will work from 00:45 through to 08:25, meaning services on Saturday night will end earlier than normal and services on Sunday morning will start later than usual.

Please check your entire journey as engineering work is also taking place on other parts of the South Western Railway network.

Monday 20 to Thursday 23 February:

Journey planners for this period will be updated towards the end of week commencing Monday 13 February.

Friday 24 February:

When landslip repairs are completed overnight on Thursday 23 February, South Western Railway will reinstate their regular timetable from Friday 24 February.   

Additional Information:

Information on alternative travel arrangements, ticket acceptance, refunds and car parking can be found on the South Western Railway website.

More background information on this large landslip in Hampshire is available from the Network Rail website.

Check before you travel:
You can check your journey up to and including Sunday 19 February using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner. 

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your replacement bus by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Twitter:
If you would like to follow this incident on Twitter, please use #Hook

Compensation:
You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Routes between London Waterloo and Basingstoke / Bournemouth / Southampton Central / Weymouth / Salisbury / Exeter St Davids

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Southeastern services from Tuesday 2 to Friday 5 May
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Southeastern network, closing some lines overnight from Tuesday evening until Friday morning.

Tuesday only:

Regular late night engineering work between Faversham, Margate and Ramsgate will not take place, and trains will run instead of the scheduled buses between these stations. 

Tuesday to Thursday:

From 23:25 until the end of service, trains running to / from London Victoria will be retimed, with some trains running up to 11 minutes later than usual. 

The 22:37 Tonbridge to Gillingham service will be replaced by a bus between Strood and Gillingham.

The 23:50 London St Pancras International to Faversham service will be replaced by buses between Ebbsfleet International / Gillingham and Faversham.

The 23:44 London Cannon Street to Canterbury West (Tuesday) / 23:38 London Charing Cross to Canterbury West (Wednesday & Thursday) will be diverted and run non-stop between London Bridge and Ashford International. A portion of coaches will be detached at Ashford International to run between Ashford International and Dover Priory. A replacement bus will run between Tonbridge and Ashford International. 

If you are travelling to Sevenoaks / Tonbridge, or connecting with the replacement bus at Tonbridge, please use alternative trains between London and Tonbridge.

Wednesday only: 

The 00:25 London Cannon Street to Dartford via Greenwich will be replaced by a bus between London Cannon Street and Dartford.

Wednesday & Thursday:

The 22:29 London Charing Cross to Ramsgate will be replaced by a bus between Minster and Ramsgate.

The 23:07 London St Pancras International to Ramsgate via Dover Priory service will be replaced by a bus between Dover Priory and Ramsgate.

The 23:37 London St Pancras International to Ramsgate via Canterbury West service will be replaced by a bus between Canterbury West and Ramsgate.

Wednesday & Friday:

From 00:40 until the end of service buses replace trains between Tunbridge Wells and Hastings and will run between: 

  • Tunbridge Wells and Hastings (calling at Wadhurst, Battle and St Leonards Warrior Square only).
  • Tunbridge Wells and West St Leonards (calling at all stations except Crowhurst).
  • Battle and Crowhurst (minibus shuttle).

 

Wednesday to Friday:

From 00:25 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Meopham and Gillingham / Faversham. A connecting train will run from Faversham to Ramsgate. The replacement buses will not serve Teynham, a minibus will run between Sittingbourne and Teynham.

The 04:17 Gillingham to Tonbridge service will start from Strood at 04:33. A replacement bus will leave Gillingham at 03:53 calling at all stations to Strood. 

Thursday & Friday:

The 00:21 London Charing Cross to Dartford via Woolwich Arsenal will be replaced by a bus between London Charing Cross and Dartford.

Buses replace trains between Gloucester / Cheltenham Spa and Birmingham New Street. 

Great Western Railway:

​​​​​​​Saturday and Sunday:

London Paddington / Swindon and Cheltenham Spa:

Trains between London Paddington / Swindon and Cheltenham Spa will start / terminate at Gloucester.

Saturday and Sunday:

Trains between Bristol Temple Meads and Cheltenham Spa / Worcester Shrub Hill / Worcester Foregate Street will start / terminate at Gloucester. 

Rail replacement buses will run between Gloucester and Worcester Foregate Street (calling at all stations).

Saturday only:

It is not yet known how Transport for Wales will be affected.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service to / from Glasgow Queen Street on Sunday 16 April
PtIncident.Description:
Track work is taking place between Glasgow Queen Street and Bishopbriggs, closing some lines.

Glasgow Queen Street - Aberdeen / Inverness / Elgin services

Buses replace trains between Glasgow Queen Street and Perth

Glasgow Queen Street - Edinburgh (via Falkirk High) services

Until approximately 10:30 buses will replace trains between Glasgow Queen Street and Edinburgh calling at Croy, Falkirk High, Polmont, Linlithgow and Haymarket.

Thereafter train services are diverted and will not call at Croy and Falkirk High. Trains will call additionally at Falkirk Grahamston. There will be revised departure and arrival times at Glasgow Queen Street.

Buses replace trains between Glasgow Queen Street and Linlithgow calling at Croy, Falkirk High and Polmont.

Glasgow Queen Street - Alloa services

Train services operate at revised times and do not call at Bishopbriggs, Lenzie and Croy.

Buses replace trains between Glasgow Queen Street and Stirling, calling at Bishopbriggs, Lenzie, Croy and Larbert.

Glasgow Queen Street - Cumbernauld services

Until approximately 10:30 buses replace trains between Glasgow Queen Street and Cumbernauld.

Thereafter train services operate at normal times, but most are extended to Alloa.

Glasgow Queen Street - Anniesland services

Train services are cancelled. Buses replace trains.

Glasgow Queen Street - Oban services

Buses replace trains between Glasgow Queen St and Crianlarich which connect with trains at Crianlarich.

An express bus service will operate between Glasgow Queen Street and Crianlarich to connect into train services.

There will also be buses between Glasgow Queen Street and Crianlarich which call at Dalmuir, Dumbarton Central, Helensburgh Upper, Garelochhead, Arrochar & Tarbet, and Ardlui.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

No trains will  run between London St Pancras International and London Blackfriars.

You may use your ticket on London Buses / London Underground to travel across Central London.

Thameslink services that usually run via Farringdon will run to an amended timetable between Bedford / Peterborough / Cambridge and Finsbury Park / London St Pancras International, and also between London Blackfriars / London Bridge and Horsham / Brighton.

No Thameslink trains will run to / from Sutton. For Sutton, you can use your ticket on Southern services, or with London Buses / Tramlink / London Underground Northern line services.

A few late night / early morning replacement buses will run between London St Pancras International and London Bridge.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

You can plan your journey on London Buses / London Underground / Tramlink by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your replacement bus by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: All Thameslink services via Farringdon

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service in the Westbury area from Sunday 30 April to Wednesday 3 May
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between in the Westbury area, closing some lines.

Sunday: 

Trains between Bristol Temple Meads / Swindon and Frome/Weymouth will terminate / start Westbury.

Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton via Bristol Temple Meads. 

Trains departing from London Paddington and Reading will do so earlier than normal.

Trains between London Paddington and Weston-super-Mare / Taunton will  be a revised service with some trains to terminate / start at Bristol Temple Meads.

Trains will operate between Castle Cary, Yeovil Pen Mill and stations to/from Weymouth but with revised times. 

To maintain connections, some trains between Paignton/Exeter St Davids and Exmouth and between Exeter St Davids and Barnstaple / Okehampton will be retimed by a few minutes from early afternoon.

Road transport will operate between Westbury / Frome / Bruton / Castle Cary and Taunton.

Monday: 

Trains between Bristol Temple Meads and Weymouth will terminate / start Westbury.

Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton via Bristol Temple Meads. 

Trains departing from London Paddington and Reading will do so earlier than normal.

Trains between Castle Cary / Yeovil Pen Mill and stations to / from Weymouth will operate to a revised timetable.

Road transport will operate between Westbury / Frome / Bruton / Castle Cary and Taunton.

Tuesday and Wednesday: 

Most trains between Bristol Temple Meads and Weymouth will terminate / start Frome. 

Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton via Bristol Temple Meads.

Trains between Castle Cary /Yeovil Pen Mill and stations to / from Weymouth will operate to a revised timetable.

Road transport will operate between Westbury / Frome / Bruton / Castle Cary and Taunton. Most buses will start / terminate at Westbury, and you should change between rail / road transport here.

Check before you travel:

These changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

PtIncident.Summary: No trains to / from Carstairs from Saturday 4 March to Sunday 28 May
PtIncident.Description:
Major Improvement Work is taking place in the Carstairs area, closing all lines.

Most ScotRail services that operate via Carstairs are cancelled with a small number rerouted via Shotts.

A replacement bus service will operate between Fauldhouse and Carstairs calling at Carluke.

  • If you would normally use the Edinburgh to Glasgow via Carstairs services to travel between Glasgow and Lanarkshire, you should use ScotRail services operating between Glasgow and Lanark.
  • Replacement buses will operate between Carstairs and Carluke. Buses at Carluke will connect with train services operating between Glasgow and Lanark.
  • Replacement buses will operate between Carluke, Carstairs and Fauldhouse. Buses at Fauldhouse will connect with train services operating between Glasgow and Edinburgh via Shotts.
  • Ticket acceptance will be in place on Stuart's Coaches between Carstairs and Lanark.

 

Monday to Fridays

05:49 Carstairs to Glasgow Central will start from Carluke at 05:57.

07:05 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh will not call at Motherwell, Wishaw, Carluke or Carstairs. Calls additionally at Uddingston and Bellshill.

07:18 Carstairs to Glasgow Central will start from Wishaw at 07:33.

07:39 Carstairs to Garscadden will start from Wishaw at 07:50.

07:42 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central will not call at Carstairs, Carluke, Wishaw or Motherwell.

17:37 Anderston to Carstairs terminates Wishaw at 18:08.

18:25 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central will not call at Carstairs, Carluke, Wishaw or Motherwell. Calls additionally at Bellshill and Uddingston.

22:33 Dalmuir to Carstairs terminates at Motherwell at 23:34.

23:13 Edinburgh to Motherwell will not call at Carstairs, Carluke or Wishaw. Calls additionally at Shotts and arriving Motherwell  at 00:13.

The following services will not run:

06:59 Motherwell to Carstairs
09:43 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh
10:20 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central
11:45 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh
11:56 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central
13:42 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh
13:51 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central

19:47 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh

Saturday

07:05 Glasgow Central to Edinburgh will not call at Motherwell, Wishaw, Carluke or Carstairs. Calls additionally at Uddingston and Bellshill.

07:42 Edinburgh to Glasgow Central will not call at Carstairs, Carluke, Wishaw or Motherwell.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning service to / from Worksop from Monday 20 to Friday 24 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place overnight between Worksop and Mansfield Woodhouse, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

The 21:25 Nottingham to Worksop train will terminate at Mansfield Woodhouse. A rail replacement bus will run from Mansfield Woodhouse, departing at 22:16 and calling at Shirebrook at 22:29, Langwith-Whaley Thorns at 22:35, Creswell at 22:45, Whitwell at 22:51 and arriving Worksop at 23:06.

The 22:25 Nottingham to Worksop will terminate at Mansfield Woodhouse. A rail replacement bus will run from Mansfield Woodhouse departing at 23:16 and calling at Shirebrook at 23:29, Langwith-Whaley Thorns at 23:35, Creswell at 23:45 and arriving Worksop at 00:06.

The 22:39 Worksop to Nottingham train will start from Mansfield Woodhouse. A rail replacement bus will run from Worksop departing at 22:10, calling at Whitwell at 22:23, Creswell at 22:29, Langwith-Whaley Thorns at 22:39, Shirebrook at 22:45 and Mansfield Woodhouse at 23:00 to connect in with the 23:10 departure to Nottingham. 

The 23:43 Worksop to Nottingham train will start from Mansfield Woodhouse. A rail replacement will run from Worksop departing at 23:10, calling at Shirebrook at 23:41 and Mansfield Woodhouse at 23:56 to connect in with the 00:06 departure to Nottingham. 

Tuesday to Friday

The 05:35 Worksop to Nottingham service will start from Mansfield Woodhouse. A rail replacement bus will run from Worksop departing at 05:06, calling at Whitwell at 05:19, Creswell at 05:25, Langwith-Whaley Thorns at 05:35, Shirebrook at 05:41 and Mansfield Woodhouse at 05:56 to connect with the 06:06 departure to Nottingham. 

Check before you travel:

PtIncident.Summary: No trains to / from London Charing Cross / Waterloo East on Saturday 8 and Sunday 9 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Charing Cross and London Bridge, closing all lines.

No trains will run to / from / via Waterloo East and London Charing Cross.

Saturday: 

Paddock Wood Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory / Ramsgate via Canterbury West will be diverted to run to / from London Victoria. 

Hastings Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Hastings will run to / from London Cannon Street, and will be retimed as they will use an alternative route between London Bridge and Orpington. These trains will only run between London Cannon Street and Tunbridge Wells because of further engineering work. 

Maidstone East line: Services between London Charing Cross and Maidstone East will run from London Victoria instead, and will call additionally at Bromley South.

Hayes Line: Services between London Charing Cross and Hayes will run to / from London Cannon Street at a reduced frequency (every 30 minutes).

Grove Park Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Sevenoaks will run to / from London Cannon Street. Saturday services between London Cannon Street and Orpington will not run.

Sidcup Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Gravesend via Sidcup will be not run, and services between London Charing Cross and Dartford via Sidcup will run to / from London Cannon Street, calling at all stations between Lewisham and Dartford. 

Bexleyheath Line: Trains between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Bexleyheath will be retimed and will run to / from Dartford. Services between London Victoria and Dartford via Bexleyheath will not run. 

Woolwich Line: Services between London Cannon Street and Gravesend via Lewisham and Woolwich will call at all stations between Dartford and Gravesend. Trains between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Greenwich / Woolwich Arsenal will be retimed and will run to / from Dartford.

Sunday: 

Paddock Wood Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory / Ramsgate via Canterbury West will be diverted to run to and from London Victoria. Services between London Victoria and Dover Priory will only run between London Victoria and Ashford International because of further engineering work. 

Hastings Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Hastings will run to / from London Cannon Street, and will be retimed as they will use an alternative route between London Bridge and Orpington. These trains will only run between London Cannon Street and Tunbridge Wells because of further engineering work. 

Grove Park Line: Buses will replace trains on the Grove Park line because of further engineering work 

Sidcup Line: Buses will replace trains on the Sidcup line because of further engineering work 

Bexleyheath Line: Trains between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Bexleyheath will be retimed and will run to / from Dartford. Services between London Victoria and Dartford via Bexleyheath will not run. 

Woolwich Line: Trains between London Cannon Street and Slade Green via Greenwich / Woolwich Arsenal will be retimed and will run to / from Dartford.

Ticket Acceptance: 

You can use the following services at no extra cost: 

London Underground between Victoria, Cannon Street, London Bridge, Southwark, Waterloo, Embankment and Charing Cross. 

London Buses routes P12 / 78 / 484 between Denmark Hill and Lewisham.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning East Midlands Railway service to / from London St Pancras International from Monday 6 to Friday 10 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place overnight at various locations on the East Midlands Railway Network, closing some lines.

Monday to Friday

The 17.35 London St. Pancras International to Nottingham is retimed to assist in the operation of other services and is retimed after departing East Midlands Parkway, arriving into Nottingham four minutes later than usual at 19.17.

The 21.45 Sheffield to London St. Pancras International runs as per normal through to and including Kettering, before calling additionally at Luton and terminating there. You should use alternative services for travel through to London.

The 22.47 London St. Pancras International to Corby departs Kettering one minute later and arrives into Corby two minutes later than usual.

The 23.35 London St. Pancras International to Nottingham arrives at and departs from Kettering one minute later than usual, with no other changes to the schedule.

Tuesday to Friday

The 03.57 Derby to London St. Pancras International is retimed to depart Derby and station calls through to and including Kettering one minute earlier than usual, before regaining usual arrival time in London. The connecting bus 03.30 Nottingham to East Midlands Parkway is retimed to run one minute earlier throughout.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Affects.RoutesAffected: 17:35 London St Pancras International to Nottingham

PtIncident.Summary: Amended East Midlands Railway service to / from London St Pancras International until 10:30 on Sunday 5 March

Engineering work is taking place between London St Pancras International and Bedford, closing some lines.

Due to the above work East Midlands Railway will operate an amended timetable with the following alterations:-

Additional service

The 08.43 Luton to Sheffield, calling at Bedford(dep 09.04), Wellingborough(dep 09.16), Kettering(dep 09.23), Market Harborough(dep 09.33), Leicester(dep 09.48), Loughborough(dep 09.58), East Midlands Parkway(dep 10.06), Long Eaton(dep 10.10), Derby(dep 10.20) and Chesterfield(dep 10.40), arriving into Sheffield at 10.55 l

The 09.20 Luton to Nottingham, calling at Bedford(dep 09.41), Wellingborough(dep 09.53), Kettering(dep 10.00), Market Harborough(dep 10.10), Leicester(dep 10.26), Loughborough(dep 10.36), East Midlands Parkway(dep 10.43) and Beeston(dep 10.50), arriving into Nottingham at 10.55.  

The 07.00 Derby to London St. Pancras International and 07.24 Nottingham to London St. Pancras International services both arrive earlier into Luton and terminate there, with onward travel to London to be done via alternative services.

The 09.00 London St. Pancras International to Nottingham is retimed to depart London later (at 09.10) and runs later to all stations through to Nottingham.  

The 10.30 London St. Pancras International to Sheffield is retimed to depart Luton five minutes later than usual (at 11.08), before regaining its usual schedule on arrival at Bedford.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Late night / early morning amended services between Leeds and Micklefield from Monday 17 until Friday 21 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Leeds and Micklefield late night / early morning, closing some lines. 

The following amendments will take place:

Monday to Thursday:

  • The 20:19 Blackpool North to York service will terminate at Leeds.  A bus will be provided from Leeds to York
  • The 21:18 Blackpool North to York service will terminate at Leeds.  A bus will be provided from Leeds to York
  • The 22:15 Hull to Halifax service will start from Leeds
  • The 22:20 York to Blackpool North service will start from Leeds.  A bus will be provided from York to Leeds
  • The 22:21 Halifax to Hull service will run between Halifax and Leeds, and between Selby and Hull.  A bus will be provided between Leeds and Hull
  • The 22:31 Hull to Leeds service will terminate at Selby.  A bus will be provided from Selby to Leeds
  • The 23:14 York to Leeds service will be bus replaced throughout

 

Tuesday to Friday:

  • The 05:19 York to Blackpool North service will start from Leeds.  A bus will be provided from York to Leeds
  • The 05:20 Leeds to York service will be a bus replacement throughout

 

Check before you travel:

High Speed services:

Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton or between Reading and Westbury, with most calling additionally at Swindon, Westbury and Castle Cary.

Trains between London Paddington and Exeter St David's / Paignton / Plymouth which normally call at Newbury and Pewsey will not run. 

Due to diversions, some trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance over the route between Swindon and Westbury, and a few local trains between Swindon and Westbury will be retimed by up to 26 minutes.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Reading and Newbury / Hungerford
  • Swindon and Pewsey

 

Local services:

To maintain connections with re-timed services:

  • Some trains between Paignton / Exeter St David's and Exmouth will be retimed by a few minutes from early afternoon.
  • Some evening trains between Exeter St David's and Barnstaple / Okehampton will be retimed by a few minutes.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night services between Bridgend and Port Talbot Parkway from Monday 17 to Thursday 20 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Cardiff Central and Bridgend each evening and also on 1 out of 2 tracks between Bridgend and Port Talbot Parkway on Monday, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday:

  • The 20:48 London Paddington to Swansea service will divert between Cardiff Central and Bridgend (via Ninian Park, not calling). It will depart Bridgend and beyond a few minutes later than normal. On Monday only the train will incur a further 8 minutes journey time between Bridgend and Port Talbot Parkway.
  • The 21:48 London Paddington to Swansea service will operate via this route as normal (via Ninian Park, not calling). On Monday only the train will incur a further 8 minutes additional journey time between Bridgend and Port Talbot Parkway.

 

Monday, Tuesday and Thursday:

  • The 22:48 London Paddington to Swansea service (also diverted between Swindon and Bristol Parkway) will further divert between Cardiff Central and Bridgend (via Ninian Park, not calling) incurring a few minutes additional journey time between these two stations. On Monday only, the train will incur a further 8 minutes journey time between Bridgend and Port Talbot Parkway.

 

Wednesday:

PtIncident.Summary: Amended service to / from Crewe from Saturday 8 to Monday 10 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Crewe and Stafford, closing some lines.

CrossCountry

Except for the listed trains below, trains will not call at Crewe. 

Exceptions:

The 05:11 Manchester Piccadilly to Bournemouth service on Saturday 8 and Monday 10 April.

You can use London Northwestern Railway services between Crewe and Stafford.

London Northwestern Railway

The following amendments will be made:

Saturday and Monday

  • Trains running between Birmingham New Street and Liverpool Lime Street will be revised to run between Birmingham New Street and Stafford, and between Crewe and Liverpool Lime Street 
  • Trains running between London Euston and Crewe will be revised to run between Milton Keynes Central and Stafford only (engineering work will also be taking place between London Euston and Milton Keynes Central). Rail replacement buses will operate between Stafford and Crewe

 

Trains between Birmingham New Street and Crewe (via Stoke-on-Trent) will run as normal.

Sunday 

  • Trains running between Birmingham New Street and Liverpool Lime Street will be revised to run between Birmingham New Street and Stafford
  • Trains running between London Euston and Crewe will be revised to run between Milton Keynes Central and Stafford only (engineering work will also be taking place between London Euston and Milton Keynes Central). Rail replacement buses will operate between Stafford / Liverpool South Parkway and Crewe. Customers are advised to travel on Merseyrail services between Liverpool South Parkway and Liverpool Central

 

Trains between Birmingham New Street and Crewe (via Stoke-on-Trent) will run as normal.

The 23:48 London Liverpool Street to Colchester services will be replaced by a bus service between Witham and Colchester.

Tuesday to Thursday

The 00:18 and 00:46 London Liverpool Street to Colchester services will be replaced by a bus service between Witham and Colchester.

The 04:43 Colchester to London Liverpool Street service will start from Witham at 05:00. A connecting rail replacement bus service will be in operation from Colchester to Witham, departing Colchester at 04:10, Marks Tey at 04:22, and Kelvedon at 04:32, arriving at Witham at 04:50.

PtIncident.Summary: No Gatwick Express / Southern trains to / from London Victoria on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at London Victoria, closing all Gatwick Express / Southern lines.

No Gatwick Express / Southern trains will run to / from London Victoria.

Gatwick Express services will not run. You can use Southern or Thameslink services between London and Gatwick Airport.

Replacement buses will run between Clapham Junction and East Croydon via West Croydon.

Trains on the Brighton, Eastbourne / Ore / Portsmouth Harbour / Southampton Central / Bognor Regis / Littlehampton / East Grinstead routes will be diverted to operate to / from London Bridge, running to an amended timetable with some extended journey times.

Trains on the Horsham / Dorking route will also run to / from London Bridge, running non-stop between Mitcham Eastfields and London Bridge. Trains will run to an amended timetable between Streatham Hill and Sutton via West Croydon.

Trains will run to an amended timetable between London Bridge and Caterham / Tattenham Corner via Purley.
Uckfield services will operate to / from East Croydon (on Saturday only). You can use alternative trains between East Croydon and London.

Trains between London Bridge and London Victoria via Crystal Palace will not run.

Trains will run between Selhurst and Epsom Downs via Sutton and West Croydon.

No direct services will operate between London and Reigate. Trains will run between Reigate and Redhill. You can use alternative trains between Redhill and London.

Ticket acceptance:

You can use your tickets on:

  • London Underground between Victoria and Clapham Junction / Balham / London Bridge, and also between London Bridge and Canada Water.
  • London Bus route 255 between Balham and Streatham Hill, and also routes 170 / 319.
  • London Overground between Canada Water and Crystal Palace / West Croydon via New Cross Gate / Sydenham.
  • South Western Railway between Clapham Junction and London Waterloo.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

You can plan your journey on London Underground / London Buses by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Amended Caledonian Sleeper services from Saturday 8 to Friday 14 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Caledonian Sleeper network, closing some lines.

Caledonian Sleeper Services will be diverted away from the usual route. 

Services starting on Sunday, Monday and Friday will be retimed and diverted and will be unable to call at Watford Junction, Crewe, Preston, Carlisle, Carstairs or Motherwell. 

Services departing from their origin between Tuesday and Thursday will be retimed and diverted, and will be unable to call at Carstairs or Motherwell. 

Additionally, all services on Sunday, and services from London departing on Monday will arrive / depart from London Kings Cross instead of London Euston. 

On Saturday, Monday and Tuesday, the Edinburgh to Aberdeen service is cancelled throughout, no alternative transport is provided. 

On Sunday, the 20:34 Aberdeen to Edinburgh service is cancelled throughout, no alternative transport is provided.

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Amended evening / morning services in the Taunton area from Monday 3 to Thursday 6 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Highbridge & Burnham and Taunton, closing various lines overnight from Monday evening until Thursday morning.

Monday to Wednesday:

From Bristol Temple Meads:

The 20:00 Cardiff Central to Taunton service will arrive / depart Bridgwater and arrive Taunton a few minutes later than normal.

The 22:00 Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St Davids service will depart at 22:03 and will divert between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton (via Westbury - not calling). It will not call at stations from Bedminster to Bridgwater. It will depart Taunton and beyond later than normal. A replacement bus will run from Bristol Temple Meads to Taunton, calling all stations.

The 22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth service will operate non-stop between Bristol Temple Meads and Weston-super-Mare (set down only). It will not call at Nailsea & Backwell, Yatton or Worle. It will then set down only a few minutes earlier than normal at Highbridge & Burnham, Bridgwater and Taunton. Normal timings setting down only at Tiverton Parkway and beyond. A replacement bus will run from Bristol Temple Meads setting down only at Nailsea & Blackwell, Yatton and Worle only.

The 23:05 Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St Davids service will arrive / depart Bridgewater a few minutes later than normal. It will set down only at Taunton, Tiverton Parkway and Exeter St Davids a few minutes later than normal.

Towards Bristol Temple Meads:

The 17:50 Penzance to London Paddington service will divert between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (via Westbury - not calling). The train will continue towards London Paddington later than normal.

The 19:15 Penzance to Bristol Temple Meads service will divert between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (via Westbury - not calling). It will not call at Bridgwater, Highbridge & Burnham, Weston-super-Mare or Yatton. It will arrive at Bristol Temple Meads later than normal. A replacement bus will run from Taunton to Bridgwater, Highbridge & Burnham, Weston-super-Mare and Yatton, continuing to Bristol Temple Meads.

The 20:24 Exmouth to Cardiff Central service will divert between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (via Westbury - not calling), where it will terminate. It will not call stations from Bridgwater to Nailsea & Backwell.
Rail connection Bristol Temple Meads - Cardiff Central. A replacement bus will run from Taunton to all stations to Weston-super-Mare, then Worle, Yatton, Nailsea & Backwell and Bristol Temple Meads.

The 21:08 Paignton to Bristol Temple Meads service will terminate Taunton. Connects into train and the replacement bus below.

The 22:44 Taunton to Bristol Temple Meads service will divert between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (via Westbury - not calling). A replacement bus will run from Taunton to Bristol Temple Meads calling all stations.

Tuesday to Thursday:

The 05:25 Bristol Temple Meads to Exmouth service will start from Taunton. If you are travelling from Bristol Temple Meads and stations to Bridgwater, then you can travel by earlier or later services.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway between London Paddington / Cardiff Central / Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton / Exeter St Davids / Exmouth / Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance

PtIncident.Summary: Amended Great Western Railway services to / from London Paddington on Sunday 26 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Hayes & Harlington and West Drayton, closing some lines from 08:00 until 18:00.

High speed services:

London Paddington - Bristol Temple Meads (and beyond):

The 09:00 London Paddington to Weston-super-Mare service will depart 09:03.

From 10:30 London Paddington to Weston-super-Mare until 17:30 London Paddington to Weston-super-Mare inclusive, these trains at will depart 7 minutes earlier than normal.

The 20:30 London Paddington to Weston-super-Mare service will depart earlier at 20:23 and will call additionally Didcot Parkway.

London Paddington - Exeter St Davids / Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance:

The 07:51 and 08:51 London Paddington to Penzance services will depart earlier at 07:52 and 08:53, respectively.

The 10:36 and 12:36 London Paddington to Paignton services will depart earlier at 10:33 and 12:33, respectively.

The 14:36 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids and 16:37 London Paddington to Plymouth services will depart earlier at 14:33 and 16:33, respectively.

Other services:

The 14:13 London Paddington to Cardiff Central service will start from Reading.

The 10:03 Bristol Parkway to London Paddington will depart earlier at 09:45 and will call additionally Didcot Parkway.

The 12:24 Bristol Parkway to London Paddington service will terminate at Reading.

Local trains:

The 08:28 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway service will be amended to depart at 08:30.

From 09:28 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway until 17:27 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway inclusive, these trains will depart at 35 minutes past the hour and will not call at Ealing Broadway or Hayes & Harlington. Customers for these stations can travel by alternative services.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway services to / from London Paddington

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning East Midlands Railway service from Monday 20 to Friday 24 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place overnight tat various locations on the East Midlands Railway network, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

The 23:05 London St Pancras International to Derby will run unaltered until 23:46 Luton Airport Parkway, then calling later at Wellingborough 00:31, Kettering 00:50, Leicester 01:06, Loughborough 01:56, East Midlands Parkway 02:03 and arriving in Derby at 02:35. This service will not call at Long Eaton, there will be a rail repacement bus service between East Midlands Parkway and Derby at 02:13.

The 23:35 London St Pancras International to Nottingham will arrive later than normally advertised Kettering 01:08, Leicester 02:13, Loughborough 02:23, East Midlands Parkway 02:30, Beeston, 02:37 and Nottingham 02:43.

The 23:54 London St Pancras International Corby will run on time Bedford 01:00 and will then arrive later than normally advertised at Wellingborough 01:18, Kettering 01:29, Corby 01:38.

Tuesday to Friday:

The 00:15 London St. Pancras will run unaltered until Bedford at 01:22 and will then run later calling later at Wellingborough 01:40, Kettering 01:54, Leicester 02:59 and Derby 03:42.

The 03:37 Derby to London St. Pancras International will depart earlier at 0312, 03:51 East midlands Parkway, 03:58 Loughborough, 04:29 Leicester and will continue unaltered from Kettering at 05:22. This service will not call at Long Eaton, there will be a replacement bus service between Derby and East Midlands Parkway departing at 03:04.

The 04:12 Derby to London St Pancras International will depart earlier at 03:43, East Midlands Parkway 04:17, Loughborough 04:24, Leicester 04:41.

The 04:47 Derby to London St Pancras Internation will depart earlier at 04:22 calling earlier at Nottingham at 05:11, Beeston at 05:17, East Midlands Parkway at 05:27,  and will continue unaltered to Kettering, it will then arrive 8 minutes late into London St Pancras at 07:09. This service will not call at Long Eaton, there will be a replacement bus service between Derby and Nottingham departing 03:56.

The 04:58 Sheffield to London St Pancras International  will be amended to start earlier at 04:37, 04:49 Chesterfield, Derby 05:09 and will continue unaltered from East Midlands Parkway at 05:43.  This service will not call at Long Eaton a rail replacement bus service will depart Derby at 05:19 to Long Eaton.

PtIncident.Summary: No Southeastern services to / from London Victoria on Sunday 26 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place near London Victoria, closing some lines.

As a result London Victoria will be closed to Southeastern services all day. Trains will be diverted to start / terminate at London Cannon Street or London Blackfriars instead.

  • Sole Street Line: Trains between London Victoria and Ramsgate / Dover Priory via Faversham will be diverted to run to / from London Cannon Street and will run non-stop between London Victoria and St Mary Cray or Swanley. Services to / from Dover Priory will only run between London Cannon Street and Canterbury East because of further engineering work.
  • Maidstone East Line: Trains between London Victoria and Ashford International via Maidstone East will be diverted to run to / from London Cannon Street and will run non-stop between London Victoria and St Mary Cray.
  • Bromley South Line: Trains between London Victoria and Orpington via Beckenham Junction will be diverted to run to / from London Blackfriars and will be unable to stop at Brixton, but will stop additionally at Elephant & Castle.
  • Bexleyheath Line: Trains between London Victoria and Dartford via Bexleyheath will not run. Additional trains will run from London Charing Cross to Slade Green via Bexleyheath because of further engineering work near Dartford.

 

Ticket Acceptance

You can use the following services at no extra cost:

  • London Underground services between London Victoria, Brixton, Elephant & Castle, London Blackfriars, London Cannon Street, London Bridge, Southwark, London Waterloo, Embankment and London Charing Cross.
  • Thameslink between London Blackfriars, Bromley South, Swanley and Sevenoaks.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

You can plan your journey on London Underground by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

Affects.RoutesAffected: Southeastern to / from London Victoria

PtIncident.Summary: Amended Caledonian Sleeper services from Sunday 1 to Friday 7 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in and around the Carstairs area, closing some lines.

As a result all services will be diverted away from their usual route.

Sunday and Friday:

All services will be retimed and diverted and will not call at Watford Junction, Crewe, Preston, Carlisle, Carstairs or Motherwell.

On Friday, all trains will be amended to run to / from London Kings Cross instead of London Euston. It is only a short distance between these two stations.

Monday to Thursday:

All services will be retimed and diverted and will not call at Carstairs or Motherwell.

On Thursday, all trains from Scotland to London will run to London Kings Cross instead of London Euston. It is only a short distance between these two stations.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended morning Great Western Railway services in the London Paddington area on Sunday 2 April
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Paddington and Ealing Broadway, closing various lines.

The 00:34 London Paddington to Reading will depart approximately 20 minutes earlier than normal. An additional train will depart Ealing Broadway at 01:00, calling at Southall, Hayes & Harlington, West Drayton, Iver, Langley, Slough, Burnham, Taplow, Maidenhead, Twyford and Reading. London Underground connections from Central London to Ealing Broadway.

The 06:34 London Paddington to Reading and 07:28 London Paddington to Didcot Parkway will start from Ealing Broadway. London Underground connections from Central London to Ealing Broadway.

The 06:20 Reading to London Paddington will terminate Ealing Broadway. London Underground connections from Ealing Broadway to Central London.

To compensate for some Elizabeth line trains starting / terminating Maidenhead instead of Reading:

The 08:13 London Paddington to Exeter St Davids will depart earlier at 08:08 and will call additionally at Maidenhead and Twyford. An additional train at 09:36 Maidenhead to Twyford and Reading.

The 08:47 Newbury to Reading will extend to Twyford and Maidenhead.

To connect with slightly revised services at Maidenhead:

The 15:29, 16:29, 17:29, 18:29, 19:29 and 20:29 Maidenhead to Marlow will depart 3 minutes later than normal.

The 21:35 Maidenhead to Marlow will depart 21:37.

The 22:01 Marlow to Maidenhead will depart 22:03.

London Waterloo to Reading services will be amended and will be diverted between Clapham Junction and Twickenham, calling additionally at Wimbledon and Kingston.

London Waterloo to Windsor & Eton Riverside services will be amended. An hourly service will start from Richmond. An hourly service will be diverted between Clapham Junction and Twickenham via Kingston calling at all stations.

London Waterloo to London Waterloo via Wimbledon and Kingston services will be revised and will run between Kingston and Richmond only.

Buses will run between Clapham Junction and Twickenham calling at all stations except St Margarets.

London Waterloo to Woking via Staines services will start from Kew Bridge.

Buses will run between Clapham Junction and Kew Bridge.

The afternoon and evening London Waterloo to Kingston via Hounslow services will not run.

London Waterloo to Guildford via Woking stopping services will depart later from London Waterloo.

This means that a rail service is currently unable to run from Monday to Saturday (there is no service on this line on Sunday). A replacement bus service will operate in its place.

Buses will replace trains between Bedford and Bletchley until at least Saturday 20 May.

More information:

You can view the bus timetable here.

Please note that replacement buses will not run on any strike dates.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night trains via Haslemere from Monday 13 to Thursday 16 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place overnight between Haslemere and Havant, closing some lines.

The following services will be amended:

21:45 London Waterloo to Portsmouth & Southsea service will not run.

22:00 London Waterloo to Portsmouth Harbour service calls additionally at Clapham Junction Worplesdon, Milford and Witley and terminate at Haslemere.  A replacement bus service will operate from Haslemere calling all stations to Havant and connecting into an additional service at 00:37 from Havant to Portsmouth Harbour calling all stations. A fast bus will also depart Haslemere connecting out of the train calling at Petersfield, Havant, Fratton, Portsmouth and Southsea and Portsmouth Harbour.

22:30 London Waterloo to Portsmouth Harbour service terminates at Haslemere. A replacement bus service will operate at 23:31 to Havant calling at Petersfield only. This will connect into an additional service at 00:37 from Havant to Portsmouth Harbour calling at all stations.

23:00 London Waterloo to Portsmouth & Southsea service terminates at Haslemere. A replacement bus service will operate at 23:55 to Portsmouth Harbour calling at all stations. (set down only at Bedhampton and Hilsea). A fast bus will also operate to Portsmouth Harbour calling at Petersfield, Havant, Fratton and Portsmouth & Southsea.

23:32 London Waterloo to Portsmouth & Southsea service terminates at Haslemere. A replacement bus service will operate at 00:40 to Portsmouth & Southsea calling all stations set down only apart from Petersfield where the bus will also pick up. Another bus will operate at 00:40 fast to Havant and then all stations to Portsmouth & Southsea set down only.

Additional services will operate from Havant to Portsmouth Harbour at 23:49, 00:22 and 00:37 calling all stations.

23:15 Haslemere to Waterloo will operate as an additional service.

22:18 Portsmouth Harbour to London Waterloo service will terminate at Havant. A replacement bus service will operate to Haslemere calling all stations. This will connect into an additional service from Haslemere to London Waterloo at 00:15.

23:19 Portsmouth Harbour to Guildford will terminate at Havant. A replacement bus service will operate to Guildford calling as per the train.

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Plymouth and Penzance from Monday 27 to Friday 31 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Liskeard and Par all week, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • Most trains between London Paddington and Penzance will start / terminate at Plymouth. Two trains in each direction will start / terminate at Liskeard.
  • Trains between Cardiff Central / Bristol Temple Meads and Penzance will start / terminate at Plymouth. 
  • A shuttle train service will operate between Plymouth and stations to / from Liskeard.
  • Trains will operate between Par and Penzance (calling at St Austell, Truro, Redruth, Camborne, Hayle and St Erth).

 

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Plymouth and St Austell (fast)
  • Liskeard and St Austell (calling at Bodmin Parkway, Lostwithiel and Par). Buses from Liskeard to St Austell will stop for customers to disembark only, and buses from St Austell to Liskeard will stop to pick customers up only.

 

The last bus from St Austell to Liskeard will continue to Plymouth.

Additionally:

  • The 23:45 (Monday to Thursday) London Paddington to Penzance "Night Riviera" Sleeper service will terminate at Plymouth. Rail replacement buses available from Plymouth to St Austell and rail connections St Austell to Plymouth. Also rail connections available from Plymouth to Liskeard where replacement buses will be available to Par.
  • The 21:45 (Monday to Friday) Penzance to London Paddington "Night Riviera" Sleeper service will start from Plymouth. Earlier rail connections available between Penzance and St Austell, then replacement buses between St Austell and Plymouth to connect into the train. Also replacement buses available between Par and Liskeard for rail connections to Plymouth.

The 22:50 London Paddington to Worcestershire Parkway will terminate Oxford. A replacement bus will run from  Oxford to Hanborough, Charlbury, Kingham, Moreton-in-Marsh, Honeybourne, Evesham, Pershore and Worcestershire Parkway.

Buses replace trains between Shrewsbury and Wolverhampton.

Rail replacement buses will run between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended evening / morning Southeastern services from Monday 6 to Friday 10 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Southeastern network, closing some lines overnight from Monday evening until Friday morning.

Monday to Thursday:

The 23:50 London St Pancras International to Faversham service will be replaced by buses between: 

  • Ebbsfleet International and Gillingham, calling at Gravesend, Strood, Rochester and Chatham.
  • Gillingham and Faversham calling at Rainham and Sittingbourne.

 

Tuesday only: 

Late night buses between Faversham, Margate and Ramsgate will not run, and trains will run normally between these stations. 

Tuesday to Friday: 

From 00:20 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Meopham and Sittingbourne. Trains will only run between London Victoria and Meopham / Sole Street. A connecting train will run between Sittingbourne and Ramsgate. 

Wednesday to Friday: 

From 00:10 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Lewisham and Dartford / Gravesend via Woolwich Arsenal and via Bexleyheath. Trains will be diverted to run via Sidcup instead. 

Thursday only: 

From 23:00 until the end of service, trains between London Charing Cross and Hayes will not run. Replacement buses will run between Lewisham and Hayes. 

Thursday and Friday:

From 00:30 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Minster and Ramsgate and also between Deal and Ramsgate. 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Amended Southeastern services to / from London Victoria on Sunday 5 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at London Victoria, closing some lines to / from the station.

Most services will be retimed and run normally, but some services will be retimed:

Bexleyheath Line: Trains between London Victoria and Dartford via Bexleyheath will be diverted to run to / from London Charing Cross instead. 

Maidstone East Line: Trains from London Victoria to Ashford International via Maidstone East will leave London Victoria 3 minutes earlier ​​​​​​​than usual. Trains towards London Victoria will run normally. 

Sole Street Line: Trains from London Victoria to Dover Priory via Denmark Hill will be retimed to leave London Victoria 2 minutes earlier than usual. Services towards London Victoria are not affected. 

Bromley South Line: Trains from London Victoria to Orpington will leave London Victoria 3 minutes earlier ​​​​​​​than usual. Trains towards London Victoria are not affected. 

Ticket Acceptance:

You can use London Underground at no extra cost between Victoria, Embankment (for Charing Cross), Charing Cross, Waterloo, Southwark and London Bridge.

Monday to Thursday

  • The 23:17 Manchester Airport to Blackpool North service will start from Preston. A rail replacement bus service will run between Manchester Airport and Preston.
  • The 23:22 Blackpool North to Manchester Airport service will be diverted via (but not calling at) Wigan North Western. It will not call at Buckshaw Parkway, Chorley, Horwich Parkway, Bolton and Salford Cresent. A rail replacement bus service will run between Preston and Manchester Airport.
  • The 23:46 Manchester Airport to Blackpool North service will start from Manchester Piccadilly and will be diverted via (but not calling at) Wigan North Western. It will not call at Salford Cresent, Bolton, Horwich Parkway, Chorley and Buckshaw Parkway. A rail replacement bus will run between Manchester Piccadilly and Preston.

 

Tuesday to Friday

  • The 04:48 Manchester Airport to Blackpool North service will start from Manchester Piccadilly and will be diverted via (but not calling at) Wigan North Western. It will not call at Salford Cresent, Bolton, Horwich Parkway, Chorley and Buckshaw Parkway. A rail replacement bus will run between Manchester Piccadilly and Preston.

PtIncident.Summary: Amendments to some late night Southeastern trains
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations on the Southeastern network, closing some lines overnight from Monday to Thursday. 

These changes may be subject to further alteration on some days, such as starting earlier, or not taking place at all. Please check your journey using the Journey Planner,  and also check other items on our engineering pages for the date of your journey.

Mondays only:

Every Monday night, Network Rail carry out essential maintenance on the lines between Ashford International and Ramsgate via Canterbury West.

From 23:50 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Ashford International and Canterbury West / Ramsgate. 

Mondays and Tuesdays:

Every Monday and Tuesday night, Network Rail carry out essential maintenance on the lines to and from London Charing Cross.  

There will be no trains at London Charing Cross or Waterloo East from approximately 23:30 until the end of service. 

Trains will run from London Cannon Street instead, and you will need to travel to / from London Cannon Street / London Bridge. 

Tuesdays only:

Every Tuesday night, Network Rail carry out essential maintenance on the lines between Faversham and Ramsgate via Margate.  

From 23:30 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Faversham and Margate / Ramsgate. 

Wednesdays and Thursdays 

Every Wednesday and Thursday night, Network Rail carry out essential maintenance on the lines to / from London Cannon Street.

There will be no trains at London Cannon Street from approximately 23:35 until the end of service. 

Trains will run to / from London Charing Cross instead, if you could please make your way to London Bridge for these trains. 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace late night trains to / from Blackburn from Monday 13 to Thursday 16 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Blackburn and Hebden Bridge / Todmorden, closing some lines.
As a result the following amendments will apply:
​​​​​​​
  • The 21:18 Blackpool North to York service will run between Blackpool North and Blackburn, and between Hebden Bridge and York. A rail replacement bus will run between Blackburn and Hebden Bridge. 
  • The 21:23 York to Blackpool North service will run between York and Hebden Bridge, and between Rose Grove and Blackpool North.  A rail replacement bus will be provided from Hebden Bridge to Blackpool North, stopping for customers to disembark only from Blackburn.
  • The 22:02 Blackpool North to Leeds service will run between Blackpool North and Blackburn, and between Halifax and Leeds.  A rail replacement bus will run between Blackburn and Leeds, stopping for customers to disembark only from Halifax.
  • The 22:04 Manchester Victoria to Blackburn service will terminate at Todmorden. A rail replacement bus will be provided from Todmorden to Blackburn.
  • The 22:20 York to Blackburn service will run between York and Halifax, and between Rose Grove and Blackburn. A rail replacement bus will run between Halifax and Blackburn.
  • The 22:20 Blackburn to Manchester Victoria service will run between Blackburn and Rose Grove, and between Todmorden and Manchester Victoria. A rail replacement bus will run between Rose Grove and Todmorden.
  • The 23:03 Manchester Victoria to Blackburn service will terminate at Todmorden. A rail replacement bus will run between Todmorden and Blackburn.
  • The 23:20 Blackburn to Manchester Victoria service will run between Blackburn and Rose Grove, and between Todmorden and Manchester Victoria. A rail replacement bus will run between Rose Grove and Manchester Victoria, stopping for customers to disembark only from Todmorden.
 
​​​​​​​

Engineering work is taking place between Rugby and Northampton, closing some lines.

On Monday, Wednesday and Thursday evening the 22:50 Birmingham New Street to Northampton service will terminate at Coventry (at 23:27).

You should use the 23:34 Coventry to London Euston (Avanti West Coast) service to Rugby. A rail replacement bus service will then run between Rugby and Northampton (calling at Long Buckby).

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: 22:50 Birmingham New Street to Northampton

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night services to / from Birmingham International from Tuesday 14 to Thursday 16 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street, closing some lines.

London Northwestern Railway

After 22:05 train services between Liverpool Lime Street / Crewe and Birmingham New Street will be diverted between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street and will arrive later at / depart earlier from Birmingham New Street. 

Transport for Wales

  • The 19:29 Aberystwyth to Birmingham International service will be diverted via a longer alternative route and will terminate at Birmingham New Street.
  • The 23:06 Birmingham International to Shrewsbury service will start from Birmingham New Street.

 

If you are travelling to / from Birmingham International you should travel on earlier rail services.

West Midlands Railway

Trains between Shrewsbury and Birmingham New Street will run between Shrewsbury and Wolverhampton only or will be diverted and will arrive later at Birmingham New Street.

Local stopping train services between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street will not run.

Rail replacement buses will operate between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street - calling at all intermediate stations.

The 22:59 Birmingham New Street to Worcester Foregate Street service is retimed to depart from Birmingham New Street at 23:10.

CrossCountry and Avanti West Coast are unaffected by this engineering work.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner​​​​​​​

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
London Northwestern Railway between Liverpool Lime Street / Crewe and Birmingham New Street

Transport for Wales between Aberystwyth / Holyhead / Chester / Shrewsbury and Birmingham International 

West Midlands Railway between Shrewsbury / Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street / Walsall / Rugeley Trent Valley

  • The 23:00 Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Airport service will terminate at Manchester Piccadilly. A rail replacement bus will run between Manchester Piccadilly and Manchester Airport.

Tuesday to Friday

Transport for Wales

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services via Theale on Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Westbury / Bedwyn, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • Trains between Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn will not run.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance (departing London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal) will divert either between Reading and Taunton or Reading and Westbury.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon.
  • Some trains (which call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey) will not run. If you are travelling to / from Newbury or Hungerford you should travel via Reading and Theale to connect with buses. If you are travelling to / from Pewsey you should travel via Swindon to connect with buses.
  • If you are travelling from Bristol Temple Meads, trains from London Paddington to Plymouth / Penzance will stop to pick up only.
  • If you are travelling to Bristol Temple Meads, trains from Penzance / Plymouth to London Paddington will stop for customers to disembark only.
  • Some trains between Paignton / Exeter St David's and Exmouth will be re-timed by a few minutes from early afternoon.
  • Some evening trains between Exeter St David's and Barnstaple, and also between Exeter St David's and Okehampton will be retimed by a few minutes.

 

Additionally, due to diversions of trains between London Paddington and Exeter St Davids / Plymouth / Penzance over the route between Swindon and Westbury (some beyond), most local stopping trains between Swindon and Westbury will be retimed and one in each direction will not run.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury
  • Swindon and Pewsey

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway between London Paddington / Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn / Exeter St Davids / Plymouth / Penzance

PtIncident.Summary: Amended trains to / from London Liverpool Street on Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Liverpool Street and Barking, closing all lines.

c2c:

Trains will be amended to run to / from London Fenchurch Street instead of to / from London Liverpool Street.

London Fenchurch Street is only a short distance from London Liverpool Street.

Elizabeth line:

No trains will run between Stratford and Shenfield. Trains will run between London Paddington (lower level) and Stratford.

Replacement buses will run between Stratford and Romford (all stations except Maryland) and between Shenfield and Newbury Park London Underground station.

Greater Anglia:

Saturday and Sunday

Norwich, Ipswich and Colchester Town mainline services will turn around at Witham all weekend.

Buses will replace trains between Witham and Newbury Park (TfL Central Line tube station).

Buses will replace trains between Southend Victoria and Newbury Park, & between Southminster and Wickford.

Your will be accepted on TfL Central Line services between Newbury Park and Stratford / London Liverpool Street.

Braintree branch line services will terminate / start from Witham.

​​​​​​​Check before you travel:

If you are travelling with c2c or Greater Anglia, you can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

If you are travelling with Elizabeth line, these changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street on Sunday 12 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Wolverhampton area, closing some lines.

Avanti West Coast:

Trains will be diverted to run via Bescot, and will not call at Sandwell & Dudley. For Sandwell & Dudley, you can use alternative services.

CrossCountry

Trains will not call at Wolverhampton.

For Wolverhampton, you should use alternative train services.

London Northwestern Railway

Train services from Liverpool Lime Street to Birmingham New Street will depart slightly earlier from Wolverhampton and will not call at Smethwick Galton Bridge.

Trains from Birmingham New Street to Liverpool Lime Street will depart earlier from Birmingham New Street and will not call at Smethwick Galton Bridge.

Train services from Birmingham New Street to Crewe (via Stoke-on-Trent) are retimed to depart from Birmingham New Street earlier / slightly later.

Most trains between Shrewsbury and Birmingham New Street will run between Shrewsbury and Wolverhampton only (the 08:25 Birmingham New Street to Shrewsbury service is retimed to depart from Birmingham New Street at 08:17).

Buses replace trains between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street.

Transport for Wales

All services will terminate at Wolverhampton, and no trains will run between Wolverhampton and Birmingham.

No alternative travel will be offered.

West Midlands Railway

Train services between Wolverhampton and Walsall will run between Birmingham New Street and Walsall only (to an amended timetable).

Buses replace trains between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street.

Check before you travel:​​​​​​​

If you are travelling with London Northwestern Railway, Transport for Wales or West Midlands Railway, you can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

If you are travelling with Avanti West Coast or CrossCountry, these changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night services to / from Plymouth from Monday 6 to Thursday 9 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Totnes and Ivybridge, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • The 16:36 London Paddington to Plymouth service will terminate at Totnes. It will connect in to the train below
  • The 17:04 London Paddington to Penzance service will call additionally at Ivybridge and will operate a few minutes later than normal beyond
  • The 17:50 Penzance to London Paddington service will terminate at Plymouth (and restart at Totnes). No connection will run between the two parts
  • The 18:00 Cardiff Central to Penzance service will terminate at Newton Abbot (and restart at Plymouth. It will connect in to the train below
  • The 18:15 Penzance to Exeter St David's service will terminate Plymouth. A rail replacement bus will run between Plymouth and Newton Abbot, for onward rail connection to stations to Exeter St Davids, also to stations to Bristol Temple Meads
  • The 18:36 London Paddington to Plymouth service will will call additionally at Ivybridge and will operate a few minutes later than normal beyond
  • 19:15 Penzance to Bristol Temple Meads will terminate Plymouth (and restart Newton Abbot - no connection between two parts). A rail replacement bus will run between Plymouth and Newton Abbot, for onward later rail connection to Exeter St Davids. Customers from stations Penzance-Plymouth travelling beyond Exeter St Davids (towards Bristol Temple Meads) to travel by earlier services
  • 21:45 Penzance to London Paddington “Night Riviera” Sleeper service will depart Plymouth and beyond later than normal
  • The 22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth service will arrive Plymouth approximately 15 minutes later than normal.
  • 22:22 Gunnislake to Exeter St Davids will terminate Plymouth. A rail replacement bus will run between Plymouth and Newton Abbot, for onward rail connection to Exeter St Davids.
  • 22:25 Plymouth to Exeter St Davids will not run and will be replaced by a bus between Plymouth and Newton Abbot for onward rail connection to Exeter St Davids.

 

The following services will incur a few minutes additional journey time between Totnes and Plymouth:

  • The 17:36, 19:04, 20:03, 21:04 London Paddington to Plymouth and the 18:04 London Paddington to Penzance services 
  • The 19:00 Cardiff Central to Plymouth service

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway between London Paddington / Cardiff Central / Bristol Temple Meads / Exeter St David's and Gunnislake / Plymouth / Penzance

A rail replacement bus will run between Swindon and Chippenham stopping for customers to disembark only at Bath Spa and Bristol Temple Meads.

 

Wednesday and Thursday

PtIncident.Summary: Amended evening trains in the Clydebank / Yoker area from Sunday 19 to Thursday 22 February
PtIncident.Description:
Vegetation control is taking place in the Yoker area, closing some lines.

Sunday:

The 22:08 Larkhall to Balloch and the 22:41 Motherwell to Balloch services are diverted and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank.   

The 22:40 Edinburgh to Dalmuir service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank. 

The 22:53 Motherwell to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill or Garscadden. 

The 23:08 Larkhall to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill or Garscadden.

Replacement buses will run between Hyndland / Garscadden and Dalmuir.

Monday to Thursday:

The 22:16 Motherwell to Dalmuir will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank. 

The 22:27 and 23:24 Springburn to Balloch services are diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank.

The 23:03 Larkhall to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer to terminate at Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 23:54 Springburn to Garscadden service is diverted via Singer to terminate Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 22:51 Edinburgh to Garscadden service is diverted via Singer to terminate Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 22:44 Dalmuir to Springburn service is diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill or Jordanhill.

The 23:03 Dalmuir to Motherwell has been diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill and Jordanhill.

The 22:44 Balloch to Springburn has been diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill and Jordanhill.

Replacement buses will run between Hyndland / Garscadden and Dalmuir.
