PtIncident.Summary: Amended services via Theale on Sunday 5 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Westbury / Bedwyn, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • Trains between Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn will not run.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance (departing London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal) will divert either between Reading and Taunton or Reading and Westbury.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon.
  • Some trains (which call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey) will not run. If you are travelling to / from Newbury or Hungerford you should travel via Reading and Theale to connect with buses. If you are travelling to / from Pewsey you should travel via Swindon to connect with buses.
  • If you are travelling from Bristol Temple Meads, trains from London Paddington to Plymouth / Penzance will stop to pick up only.
  • If you are travelling to Bristol Temple Meads, trains from Penzance / Plymouth to London Paddington will stop for customers to disembark only.
  • Some trains between Paignton / Exeter St David's and Exmouth will be re-timed by a few minutes from early afternoon.
  • Some evening trains between Exeter St David's and Barnstaple, and also between Exeter St David's and Okehampton will be retimed by a few minutes.

 

Additionally, due to diversions of trains between London Paddington and Exeter St Davids / Plymouth / Penzance over the route between Swindon and Westbury (some beyond), most local stopping trains between Swindon and Westbury will be retimed and one in each direction will not run.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury
  • Swindon and Pewsey

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

  • Preston and Blackpool North.
  • Preston and Blackpool South.

  • Buckshaw Parkway and Blackpool North / Lancaster (Saturday).
  • Manchester Airport and Blackpool North (Sunday).
  • Preston and Lancaster (Sunday​​​​​​​).

Trains that usually run between Glasgow Central / Edinburgh (amended to run to / from Carlisle because of further engineering work) and Manchester Airport will run between Carlisle and Lancaster only.

Replacement buses will run between Lancaster and Manchester Airport.

The 05:20 Leeds to York service will be replaced by a bus.

The 06:15 York to Hull service will start from Leeds. A replacement bus will run from York earlier than usual​​​​​​​ to Selby, connecting with the train at Selby.

PtIncident.Summary: No trains between Carlisle and Edinburgh / Glasgow Central via Carstairs from Saturday 4 March to Friday 21 April
PtIncident.Description:
Major improvement work is taking place at Carstairs, closing all lines.

Saturday 4 to Sunday 19 March

Avanti West Coast:

Trains to / from London Euston will start / terminate at Carlisle.

A limited service will operate between Carlisle and Glasgow Central via Dumfries.

Please note you may be required to change trains at Carlisle to complete your journey.

CrossCountry:

Buses will replace trains between Edinburgh and Motherwell.

LNER: 

On Saturday the 06:48 from Glasgow Central to London Kings Cross will start from Edinburgh at 08:00.

On Sunday the 16:30 from London Kings Cross to Glasgow Central will now terminate at Edinburgh.

Monday to Friday the 15:30 London Kings Cross to Glasgow Central service will terminate at Edinburgh and the 06:48 from Glasgow Central to London Kings Cross will start from Edinburgh at 08:00.

A rail replacement will be in place between Edinburgh and Motherwell.

ScotRail:

Most ScotRail services that operate via Carstairs are cancelled with a small number rerouted via Shotts. See here for more details.

A replacement bus service will operate between Fauldhouse and Carstairs calling at Carluke.

  • If you would normally use the Edinburgh to Glasgow via Carstairs services to travel between Glasgow and Lanarkshire, you should use ScotRail services operating between Glasgow and Lanark.
  • Replacement buses will operate between Carstairs and Carluke. Buses at Carluke will connect with train services operating between Glasgow and Lanark.
  • Replacement buses will operate between Carluke, Carstairs and Fauldhouse. Buses at Fauldhouse will connect with train services operating between Glasgow and Edinburgh via Shotts.
  • Ticket acceptance will be in place on Stuart's Coaches between Carstairs and Lanark.

 

TransPennine Express:

Trains will start / terminate at Carlisle.

A replacement bus service will operate between Carlisle and Edinburgh and also between Lockerbie and Glasgow Central.

This page will be updated as more information is made available for travel beyond Sunday 19 March.

Check before you travel:

If you are travelling with CrossCountry, LNER, ScotRail or TransPennine Express, you can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner.

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Engineering work is taking place between Liverpool Lime Street and Broad Green, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

  • The 22:43 Wilmslow to Liverpool Lime Street service will terminate at Manchester Oxford Road. A rail replacement bus will run between Manchester Oxford Road and Liverpool Lime Street.
  • The 23:30 Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Victoria service will be replaced by a bus throughout.

 

Tuesday to Friday

  • The 05:10 Liverpool Lime Street to Ellesmere Port service will start at 05:33 and will not call at stations between Liverpool Lime Street and Frodsham. A rail replacement bus will run between Huyton and Ellesmere Port.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
05:10 Liverpool Lime Street to Ellesmere Port 

22:43 Wilmslow to Liverpool Lime Street

23:30 Liverpool Lime Street to Manchester Victoria

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace late night trains between Manchester Piccadilly and Chester from Monday 27 February to Thursday 2 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Stockport and Plumley and also between Plumley and Chester, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • The 22:10 Manchester Piccadilly to Chester service will be replaced by a bus throughout. One bus will run from Manchester Piccadilly to Chester, stopping for customers to disembark only from Knutsford onwards. A second bus will run from Knutsford to Chester.
  • The 22:52 Chester to Manchester Piccadilly will be replaced by a bus throughout. One bus will run from Chester to Manchester Piccadilly, topping for customers to disembark only from Knutsford onwards. A second bus will run from Knutsford to Manchester Piccadilly.
  • The 23:13 Manchester Piccadilly to Chester service will be replaced by a bus throughout. One bus will run from Manchester Piccadilly to Chester, stopping for customers to disembark only from Knutsford onwards. A second bus will run from Knutsford to Chester.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

22:52 Chester to Manchester Piccadilly

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night services to / from Manchester Piccadilly from Monday 27 February to Thursday 2 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Wilmslow and Manchester Piccadilly and also between Congleton and Cheadle Hulme, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • The 22:46 Manchester Piccadilly to Stoke service will be replaced by a bus throughout.
  • The 22:58 Buxton to Manchester Piccadilly service will not call at Heaton Chapel or Levenshulme. A rail replacement bus will run between Stockport and Manchester Piccadilly to serve these stations.
  • The 23:12 Crewe to Manchester Piccadilly service will not call at Handforth, Cheadle Hulme, Stockport, Heaton Chapel or Levenshulme. A rail replacement bus will run between Wilmslow and Manchester Piccadilly to serve these stations.
  • The 23:16 Manchester Piccadilly to Macclesfield service will be replaced by a bus throughout.
  • The 23:23 Manchester Piccadilly to Hazel Grove service will terminate at Stockport. A rail replacement bus will run between Stockport and Hazel Grove.
  • The 23:28 Sheffield to Manchester Piccadilly service will not call at Stockport. A rail replacement bus will run between Chinley and Manchester Piccadilly, calling at Stockport.
  • The 23:36 Manchester Piccadilly to Crewe service will not call at Levenshulme, Heaton Chapel, Stockport, Cheadle Hulme or Handforth. A rail replacement bus will run between Manchester Piccadilly and Wilmslow.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended evening trains in the Clydebank / Yoker area from Sunday 12 to Thursday 16 February
PtIncident.Description:
Vegetation control is taking place in the Yoker area, closing some lines.

Sunday:

The 22:08 Larkhall to Balloch and the 22:41 Motherwell to Balloch services are diverted and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank.   

The 22:40 Edinburgh to Dalmuir service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank. 

The 22:53 Motherwell to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill or Garscadden. 

The 23:08 Larkhall to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill or Garscadden.

Replacement buses will run between Hyndland / Garscadden and Dalmuir.

A map showing the affected routes and alternative travel can be found here

Monday to Thursday:

The 22:16 Motherwell to Dalmuir will be diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank. 

The 22:27 and 23:24 Springburn to Balloch services are diverted via Singer and will not call at Jordanhill, Scotstounhill, Garscadden, Yoker or Clydebank.

The 23:03 Larkhall to Garscadden service will be diverted via Singer to terminate at Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 23:54 Springburn to Garscadden service is diverted via Singer to terminate Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 22:51 Edinburgh to Garscadden service is diverted via Singer to terminate Dalmuir and will no longer call at Garscadden.

The 22:44 Dalmuir to Springburn service is diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill or Jordanhill.

The 23:03 Dalmuir to Motherwell has been diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill and Jordanhill.

The 22:44 Balloch to Springburn has been diverted via Singer and will no longer call at Clydebank, Yoker, Garscadden, Scotstounhill and Jordanhill.

Replacement buses will run between Hyndland / Garscadden and Dalmuir.

A map showing the affected routes and alternative travel can be found here

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services to / from London Paddington on Sunday 26 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Paddington and Ealing Broadway, closing some lines all day.

High Speed services:

Trains between London Paddington and Oxford / Worcester / Great Malvern / Hereford / Bristol / Cardiff / Carmarthen / Exeter St Davids / Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance will be retimed, and will run up to 4 minutes earlier or later than usual.

Local services:

Trains between London Paddington and Didcot Parkway throughout most of the day will be retimed to run a few minutes earlier than usual, and will not call at Ealing Broadway or Hayes & Harlington.

For Ealing Broadway or Hayes & Harlington, you can use alternative train services.

Trains from Maidenhead to Marlow will be retimed to run 4 minutes later than usual, in order to connect with amended train services at Maidenhead.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway services to / from London Paddington

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services via Theale from Monday 27 February to Friday 3 March
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Bedwyn all week and also between Reading West and Theale from 20:05 until 05:05 each morning, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

Monday to Thursday (all day)

  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton (via Bristol Temple Meads, most calling). They will depart London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Exeter St Davids / Paignton / Plymouth which normally call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey will divert between Reading and Westbury (via Swindon). They will not call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey. Most will depart London Paddington and Reading later than normal.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon and some trains will not run.
  • Some trains between London Paddington and Bristol Temple Meads (and beyond) will extend to run to / from Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance
  • Most local services between Swindon and Westbury will not run. Trains that do run will be retimed.

 

Monday to Thursday until 20:00

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury will call additionally at Reading West and will terminate at Theale.
  • Most trains between Reading and Newbury will not run.
  • Trains between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.

 

Monday to Thursday after 20:00

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury / Bedwyn will start / terminate at Reading.
  • Trains between Reading and Newbury and also between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.

 

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn
  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury (calling at all stations)
  • Chippenham and Westbury (calling at Melksham and Trowbridge)

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway between London Paddington / Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn / Bristol Temple Meads / Exter St David's / Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services via Theale on Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Bedwyn, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury (operating hourly) will call additionally at Reading West and will terminate / start at Theale.
  • Most trains between Reading and Newbury will not run (but will operate late evening between Reading and Theale).
  • Trains between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance (departing London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal) will divert either between Reading and Taunton or Reading and Westbury.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon.
  • Some local trains between Swindon and Westbury will be re-timed.
  • Some trains (which call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey) will not run. If you are travelling to / from Newbury or Hungerford you should travel via Reading and Theale to connect with buses. If you are travelling to / from Pewsey you should travel via Swindon to connect with buses.
  • If you are travelling from Bristol Temple Meads, trains from London Paddington to Plymouth / Penzance will stop to pick up only.
  • If you are travelling to Bristol Temple Meads, trains from Penzance / Plymouth to London Paddington will stop for customers to disembark only.

 

Additionally, due to diversions of trains between London Paddington and Exeter St Davids / Plymouth / Penzance over the route between Swindon and Westbury (some beyond), most local stopping trains between Swindon and Westbury will be retimed and one in each direction will not run.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury
  • Swindon and Pewsey

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.1

Affects.RoutesAffected: Great Western Railway between London Paddington / Reading and Newbury / Exter St Davids / Plymouth / Penzance

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Southeastern services from Monday 20 to Friday 24 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at various locations across the Southeastern network, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

  • From 23:35 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Maidstone East and Ashford International.
  • From 23:30 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Lewisham and Hayes. Some of these buses will start from London Charing Cross instead of Lewisham.

 

Monday, Wednesday and Thursday

  • From 23:20 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Sittingbourne and Sheerness-on-Sea.
  • The 23:20 and 23:50 London St Pancras International to Faversham services will be replaced by buses between Ebbsfleet International and Gillingham (calling at Gravesend, Strood, Rochester and Chatham) and Gillingham and Faversham (calling at Rainham and Sittingbourne).

 

Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday

The 00:28 London Victoria to Orpington service will run non-stop between London Victoria and Shortlands. A rail replacement bus will run between London Victoria and Orpington calling at all stations from Herne Hill to Orpington via Beckenham Junction. You can use London Underground at no extra cost between London Victoria and Brixton.

Tuesday, Thursday and Friday

From 00:05 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Gillingham and Faversham.  A connecting train service will run from Faversham to Ramsgate.​​​​​​​

Wednesday and Thursday

The 23:07 London St Pancras International to Ramsgate via Dover Priory service will be replaced by a bus between Dover Priory and Ramsgate.

PtIncident.Summary: No trains between Ramsgate and Minster / Sandwich on Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Ramsgate and Minster / Sandwich, closing all lines.

  • Paddock Wood Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory via Ashford International will be retimed, diverted between London Bridge and Ashford International to run via Maidstone East, and extended from Dover Priory to run to / from Minster. A portion of coaches will be detached (or attached) at Ashford International and will run between Ashford International and Minster via Canterbury West. Trains that usually run between London Charing Cross and Ramsgate via Canterbury West will be retimed and only run between London Charing Cross and Ashford International.
  • High Speed via Ashford International: Trains between London St Pancras International and Margate via Canterbury West will only run between London St Pancras International and Minster. Trains between London St Pancras International and Ramsgate via Dover Priory will only run between London St Pancras International and Dover Priory.

 

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Minster and Ramsgate

PtIncident.Summary: No trains via Orpington on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between in the Orpington area, closing all lines.

As a result services will be unable to run via Orpington all weekend.

Southeastern:

Paddock Wood Line:

Saturday:

  • Trains between London Charing Cross and Ramsgate / Dover via Tonbridge will be retimed and use an alternative route between London Bridge and Sevenoaks.

 

Sunday:

  • Trains between London Charing Cross and Ramsgate via Canterbury West will be retimed and use an alternative route between London Bridge and Sevenoaks. These services will only run between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory due to further engineering works. Services between London Charing Cross and Dover Priory will be diverted between London Bridge and Ashford International to run via Maidstone East and will be extended to Minster because of further engineering work.

 

Hastings Line: Trains between London Charing Cross and Hastings will be retimed and diverted via an alternative route between London Bridge and Sevenoaks, and will be unable to stop at Orpington.

Bromley North Line: Services between Grove Park and Bromley North will be retimed (these services do not run on Sunday).

Grove Park Line: Stopping trains between London Charing Cross and Sevenoaks will only run between London Charing Cross and Chislehurst. Stopping services between London Cannon Street and Orpington will not run.

Bromley South Line: Trains between London Victoria and Orpington via Beckenham Junction will only run between London Victoria and Bromley South.

Medway Valley Line: Trains between Paddock Wood and Strood will be retimed to connect with services at Paddock Wood.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Chislehurst and Sevenoaks
  • Bromley South and Orpington

 

Thameslink:

Sunday only:

The 06:46 and 07:16 Orpington to London Victoria services will start from Bromley South at 06:59 and 07:29.

Rail replacement buses will depart Orpington earlier to connect with the trains at Bromley South.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner​​​​​​​

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services to / from London Kings Cross on Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between London Kings Cross and Stevenage, closing some lines.

Grand Central:

Trains will be diverted to run via Hertford North extending journey times.

Great Northern / Thameslink:

Buses will replace trains between Alexandra Palace and Stevenage via Welwyn Garden City. Buses will additionally call at Cockfosters Underground station.

Trains to / from Cambridge / Ely / Kings Lynn will be diverted to run via Hertford North. Trains that call at all stations to / from Cambridge will run between Stevenage and Cambridge only.

On Saturday, trains between Moorgate and Stevenage via Hertford North will run to an amended timetable, and on Sunday, these trains will be replaced by buses between Hertford North and Stevenage via Watton-at-Stone.

A shuttle train service will run on both days between Moorgate and Alexandra Palace for connections with replacement buses.

Hull Trains:

Trains will be diverted to run via Hertford North, extending journey times.

LNER:

Three trains per hour will run to and from London Kings Cross via a diversionary route between London Kings Cross and Stevenage.

Northbound services will depart London Kings Cross approximately 15 minutes earlier than normal.

Other services will start / terminate at Peterborough or be cancelled.

Lumo:

Trains will be diverted to run via Hertford North, extending journey times by up to 15 minutes.

Check before you travel:

If you are travelling with Grand Central, Great Northern, Hull Trains, LNER or Thameslink you can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

If you are travelling with Lumo, these changes are not currently shown in the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner, please check back nearer to the time of travel.

Saturday:

Trains between Blackburn and Wigan Wallgate / Kirkby will be diverted via Bolton, not calling at stations via Atherton.

Trains between Leeds and Wigan Wallgate will run between Leeds and Manchester Victoria only.

Trains between Manchester Airport and Barrow-in-Furness / Windermere will run as 2 separate services: between Manchester Airport and Buckshaw Parkway and then between Lancaster and Barrow-in-Furness / Windermere.

Trains between Manchester Airport and Blackpool North will run between Manchester Airport and Buckshaw Parkway only. 

Replacement buses will operate between the following stations:

  • between Manchester Victoria and Wigan Wallgate via Atherton
  • between Buckshaw Parkway and Blackpool North / Lancaster
  • between Manchester Victoria and Stalybridge

 

Sunday:

Trains between Manchester Airport and Blackpool North will run on a diverted route between Manchester Piccadilly and Wigan North Western only.

Trains between Manchester Airport and Barrow-in-Furness / Windermere will run between Lancaster and Barrow-in-Furness / Windermere only.

Trains between Stalybridge and Wigan North Western will not run.

Trains between Blackburn and Southport will run on a diverted route, not calling at stations via Atherton. 

Replacement buses will operate between the following stations:

  • between Manchester Piccadilly and Lancaster
  • between Manchester Victoria and Wigan Wallgate via Atherton
  • between Manchester Victoria / Manchester Piccadilly and Bolton
  • between Manchester Victoria and Stalybridge

 

Further information:

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services via Theale from Monday 20 to Friday 24 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Bedwyn all week and also between Reading West and Theale from 20:05 until 05:05 each morning, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

Monday to Friday (all day)

  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance will divert between Reading and Taunton (via Bristol Temple Meads, most calling). They will depart London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Exeter St David's / Paignton / Plymouth which normally call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey will divert between Reading and Westbury (via Swindon). They will not call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey. Most will depart London Paddington and Reading later than normal.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon and some trains will not run.
  • Some trains between London Paddington and Bristol Temple Meads (and beyond) will extend to run to / from Paignton / Plymouth / Penzance
  • Most local services between Swindon and Westbury will not run. Trains that do run will be retimed.

 

Monday to Friday until 20:00

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury will call additionally at Reading West and will terminate at Theale.
  • Most trains between Reading and Newbury will not run.
  • Trains between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.

 

Monday to Friday after 20:00

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury / Bedwyn will start / terminate at Reading.
  • Trains between Reading and Newbury and also between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.

 

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Reading and Newbury / Bedwyn
  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury (calling at all stations)
  • Chippenham and Westbury (calling at Melksham and Trowbridge)

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace late night trains between Bristol Temple Meads and Weston-Super-Mare / Taunton from Monday 20 to Thursday 23 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • The 19:15 Penzance to Bristol Temple Meads service will divert between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (via Westbury, not calling). It will not call at Bridgwater, Weston-super-Mare or Yatton. It will arrive Bristol Temple Meads later than normal. A rail replacement bus will run between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (calling at Bridgwater, Weston-super-Mare and Yatton).
  • The 20:00 Cardiff Central to Taunton service will terminate at Weston-super-Mare. A rail replacement bus will run between Weston-super-Mare and Taunton (calling and Highbridge & Burnham and Bridgwater).
  • The 20:32 London Paddington to Weston-super-Mare will terminate at Bristol Temple Meads. A rail replacement bus will run between Bristol Temple Meads and Weston-super-Mare (calling at all stations).
  • The 21:08 Paignton to Bristol Temple Meads service will terminate at Taunton. A rail replacement bus service will run between Taunton and Weston-super-Mare / Bristol Temple Meads.
  • The 22:00 (departing 22:04) Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St David's service will divert between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton (via Westbury, not calling). It will not call at stations from Bedminster to Bridgwater. It will depart Taunton and beyond later than normal. A rail replacement bus will run between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton (calling at all stations).
  • The 22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth service will divert between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton (via Westbury, not calling). It will not call at stations from Nailsea & Backwell to Bridgwater. It will call additionally at Bath Spa. A rail replacement bus service will run between Bristol Temple Meads and Taunton for customers to disembark only.
  • The 22:44 Taunton to Bristol Temple Meads service will not run and will be replaced by a bus calling at all stations.
  • The 23:05 Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St David's service will not run and will be replaced by a bus which will call at all stations to Bridgwater, then stopping for customers to disembark only at Taunton, Tiverton Parkway and Exeter St David's.
  • The 23:45 Bristol Temple Meads to Frome service will operate later than normal throughout.

 

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Theale and Bedwyn, closing some lines.

As a result the following amendments will apply:

  • Trains between London Paddington and Newbury (operating hourly) will call additionally at Reading West and will terminate / start at Theale.
  • Most trains between Reading and Newbury will not run (but will operate late evening between Reading and Theale).
  • Trains between Newbury and Bedwyn will not run.
  • Trains between London Paddington and Plymouth / Penzance (departing London Paddington and Reading earlier than normal) will divert either between Reading and Taunton or Reading and Westbury.
  • Some trains will call additionally at Swindon.
  • Some trains (which call at Newbury, Hungerford and Pewsey) will not run. If you are travelling to / from Newbury or Hungerford you should travel via Reading and Theale to connect with buses. If you are travelling to / from Pewsey you should travel via Swindon to connect with buses.
  • If you are travelling from Bristol Temple Meads, trains from London Paddington to Plymouth / Penzance will stop to pick up only.
  • If you are travelling to Bristol Temple Meads, trains from Penzance / Plymouth to London Paddington will stop for customers to disembark only.

 

Additionally, due to diversions of trains between London Paddington and Exeter St David's / Plymouth / Penzance over the route between Swindon and Westbury (some beyond), most local stopping trains between Swindon and Westbury will be retimed and one in each direction will not run.

Trains to / from Exmouth / Paignton / Okehampton / Barnstaple will be retimed by a few minutes to maintain connections with amended long distance services.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Theale and Bedwyn (calling at Thatcham, Newbury, Kintbury and Hungerford)
  • Theale and Newbury
  • Swindon and Pewsey

PtIncident.Summary: Amended services to / from Southampton Central on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Romsey and Redbridge, St Denys and Fareham and also between Eastleigh and Bournemouth, closing some lines.

Cross Country

Buses will replace trains between Eastleigh, Southampton Airport Parkway and Bournemouth.

Great Western Railway

Trains between Cardiff Central and Portsmouth Harbour will divert between Romsey and Fareham, not calling at Southampton Central. They will call additionally at Chandler's Ford and Eastleigh.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Eastleigh and Southampton Central 

 

Saturday only:

  • The 05:39 Portsmouth & Southsea to Worcester Foregate Street service will be diverted.
  • The 21:23 Portsmouth Harbour to Westbury service will divert between Eastleigh and Romsey, not calling at Southampton Airport Parkway and Southampton Central. It will regain its normal route at Romsey.

 

Sunday only:

  • The 17:40 Cardiff Central to Portsmouth Harbour service will terminate at Westbury.

 

South Western Railway:

Saturday:

Buses replace trains between:

  • Eastleigh and Bournemouth.
  • Eastleigh and Brockenhurst.
  • Eastleigh and Romsey.
  • Southampton Central and Fareham.
  • Southampton Central and Bournemouth.

 

Sunday:

Buses replace trains between:

  • Eastleigh and Bournemouth.
  • Eastleigh and Poole.
  • Eastleigh and New Milton.
  • Eastleigh and Romsey.
  • Southampton Central and Fareham.
  • Southampton Central and Bournemouth.

 

Southern:

Trains that usually run to / from Southampton Central will be amended to run to / from Portsmouth Harbour.

Replacement buses will run between Havant and Southampton Central.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
CrossCountry between Manchester Piccadilly / Reading and Southampton Central / Bournemouth 

Great Western Railway between Cardiff Central and Portsmouth Harbour 

South Western Railway between London Waterloo / Winchester / Salisbury / Eastleigh / Portsmouth & Southsea and Romsey / Southampton Central / Bournemouth / Poole / Weymouth 

Southern between London Victoria / Brighton and Southampton Central

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace trains between Upminster and Grays via Rainham on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Barking and Grays, closing some lines.

Saturday:

Until 12:00 on Saturday, services will run between London Fenchurch Street and Shoeburyness via Rainham / Stratford (4 trains per hour), and between Laindon and Shoeburyness (2 trains per hour).

Rail replacement buses are to operate between Upminster and Grays via Ockendon, and between Upminster and Laindon.

After 12:00, services will run between London Fenchurch Street and Shoeburyness via Laindon / Stratford (2 trains per hour) and via Rainham and Stratford (2 trains per hour), between Shoeburyness and Barking via Laindon (2 trains per hour), and between Upminster and Grays (2 trains per hour).

Sunday:

As a result buses will replace trains between Upminster and Grays via Rainham and Purfleet.

If you are travelling to / from Dagenham Dock you should use London Buses to complete your journey.

PtIncident.Summary: No trains to or from London Kings Cross or Moorgate from Saturday 18 to Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place at London Kings Cross, no trains will run to or from London Kings Cross all weekend.

To see the latest travel advice from each train company, please click on the below links:

  • Grand Central
  • Great Northern
  • Hull Trains
  • LNER
  • Lumo
  • Thameslink
  • Check before you Travel

 

__________________________________________

Grand Central:

As a result no Grand Central services will run on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 February.

Additionally, on Monday 20 February, the 08:27 London Kings Cross to Sunderland service is also cancelled.

__________________________________________

Great Northern:

Saturday and Sunday:

No trains will run between London Kings Cross / Moorgate and St Neots / Royston.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Alexandra Palace and Welwyn Garden City (calling at all stations and additionally at Cockfosters for London Underground services to / from London)
  • Alexandra Palace and Stevenage via Hertford North (calling at all stations)
  • Hitchin and St Neots (calling at all stations)
  • St Neots and Bedford
  • St Albans City and Hitchin (calling at Welwyn Garden City, Welwyn North, Knebworth and Stevenage)
  • Luton Airport Parkway and Stevenage (calling at Hitchin)

 

Trains will run between:

  • St Neots and Peterborough
  • Royston and Cambridge / Ely / Kings Lynn

 

__________________________________________

Hull Trains:

Saturday and Sunday:

A reduced and amended service will run, with trains being diverted to run to / from London St Pancras International instead of to / from London Kings Cross.

On these days, Hull Trains services will not call at Beverley, Cottingham, Retford or Grantham.

__________________________________________

LNER:

Saturday and Sunday:

Trains will not run between St Neots and London Kings Cross.

Replacement buses will run between St Neots and Bedford for alternative train services to / from London.

Sunday only:

Until 10:00 services will start / terminate at Grantham.

__________________________________________

Lumo:

Saturday and Sunday:

Trains will run between Edinburgh and Peterborough only. Replacement buses will run between Peterborough and London Kings Cross.

__________________________________________

Thameslink:

​​​​​​​Saturday and Sunday:

No trains will run between London Kings Cross / Moorgate / London St Pancras International (via Finsbury Park) and St Neots / Royston.

Rail replacement buses will run between:

  • Hitchin and St Neots (calling at all stations)
  • St Neots and Bedford
  • St Albans City and Hitchin (calling at Welwyn Garden City, Welwyn North, Knebworth and Stevenage)
  • Luton Airport Parkway and Stevenage (calling at Hitchin)
  • Hitchin and Royston

 

Trains will run between:

  • St Neots and Peterborough
  • Royston and Cambridge / Ely / Kings Lynn

 

Additionally, trains will run to an amended timetable between Bedford and Three Bridges / Horsham / Brighton. Some Three Bridges trains will be extended to run to / from Horsham.

__________________________________________

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
Grand Central between London Kings Cross and Bradford Interchange / Sunderland

Great Northern between London Kings Cross / Peterborough / Cambridge / Ely / Kings Lynn

Hull Trains between London Kings Cross and Hull / Beverley

LNER between London Kings Cross and Doncaster / Leeds / York / Newcastle / Edinburgh / Aberdeen / Glasgow Central

Lumo between London Kings Cross and Edinburgh

Thameslink between Brighton / Horsham / London Kings Cross and Peterborough / Cambridge

PtIncident.Summary: Buses replace early morning trains between Shrewsbury and Birmingham International on Sunday 19 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place between Wellington and Wolverhampton, closing some lines.

Transport for Wales

  • The 08:10 Shrewsbury to Birmingham International service will be replaced by a bus throughout.
  • The 09:51 Birmingham International to Aberystwyth service will start from Shrewsbury. A rail replacement bus service will run between Birmingham International and Shrewsbury.

 

West Midlands Railway

The 08:25 Birmingham New Street to Shrewsbury service will not run.

Passengers are advised to travel on the 08.28 Birmingham New Street to Crewe service between Birmingham New Street and Wolverhampton - departing from Smethwick Galton Bridge at 08.37, arriving at Wolverhampton at 08.54.

A rail replacement bus service will then operate between Wolverhampton and Shrewsbury - departing from Wolverhampton at 09:03, Bilbrook at 09.13, Codsall at 09.19, Albrighton at 09.34, Cosford at 09.45, Shifnal at 09.55, Telford Central at 10.06, Oakengates at 10:16, Wellington at 10:27, arriving at Shrewsbury at 10:52.

The 08:40 Shrewsbury to Birmingham New Street train service will not run.

A rail replacement bus service will depart from Shrewsbury at 08:16, Wellington at 08:41, Oakengates at 08:56, Telford Central at 09:05, Shifnal at 09:16, Cosford at 09:26, Albrighton at 09:37, Codsall at 09:52, Bilbrook at 09:58, arriving at Wolverhampton at 10:08.

From Wolverhampton, passengers are advised to travel on the 10:18 Wolverhampton to Walsall service between Wolverhampton and Birmingham New Street - arriving at Smethwick Galton Bridge at 10:35 and at Birmingham New Street at 10:45.

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

Replacement Bus Travel Advice:

For helpful advice if you need to travel on a rail replacement service, including accessibility and bicycle information, please use this page.

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
Transport for Wales between Aberystwyth / Shrewsbury and Birmingham International 

West Midlands Railway between Shrewsbury and Birmingham New Street

The 23:10 Manchester Piccadilly to Buxton service will depart at 23:08 and run earlier than normally advertised to Stockport.

PtIncident.Summary: Amended late night / early morning Southeastern services from Monday 13 to Friday 17 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place on various routes on the Southeastern network, closing some lines.

Monday to Thursday

From 23:20 until the end of service, trains between London Victoria and Orpington will run non stop between London Victoria and Shortlands. Replacement buses will run between London Victoria and Orpington via Beckenham Junction calling at all stations.

From 23:50 until the end of service, trains will be unable to run between Grove Park and Bromley North. You can use London buses routes 126 and 261 between Grove Park and Bromley North at no extra cost.

Monday, Wednesday and Thursday

The 23:40 London Victoria to Ramsgate service will be replaced by buses between:

  • Sittingbourne and Ramsgate (calling at Faversham, Margate, Broadstairs and Dumpton Park only)
  • Sittingbourne and Ramsgate (calling at Faversham and all stations from Faversham to Margate)

 

The 23:50 London St Pancras International to Faversham service will be replaced by buses between:

  • Ebbsfleet International and Gillingham (calling at Gravesend, Strood, Rochester and Chatham)
  • Gillingham and Faversham (calling at Rainham and Sittingbourne)

 

Tuesday only

The weekly late night engineering work between Faversham, Margate and Ramsgate will not take place.  Trains will run normally between Faversham, Margate and Ramsgate

Tuesday to Friday

From 01:00 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Slade Green and Dartford.Trains between London and Dartford via Bexleyheath will also be diverted to Slade Green to connect with the replacement bus services.

The 00:25 Victoria to Ashford Internationa; via Maidstone East service will be retimed, leaving London Victoria at 00:35.

Friday only

From 22:45 until the end of service, buses replace trains between Sheerness-on-Sea and Sittingbourne

Check before you travel:

You can plan your journey using the National Rail Enquiries Journey Planner

You can plan your journey on London Buses by using the Transport for London Journey Planner

PtIncident.Summary: Amended evening / morning trains in the Exeter area from Tuesday 14 to Friday 17 February
PtIncident.Description:
Engineering work is taking place in the Exeter area, closing some lines.

Tuesday

21:04 London Paddington to Plymouth will arrive / depart Exeter St.David's and beyond approximately 12 minutes later than normal.

22:00 and 23:05 Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St.David's will arrive at Exeter St.David's approximately 12 minutes later than normal.

22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth will arrive at Exeter St.David's (set down only) and beyond approximately 12 minutes later than normal.

23:45 London Paddington to Penzance “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will arrive at Exeter St.David's approximately 12 minutes later than normal. Normal timings departing Exeter St.David's and beyond.

19:15 Penzance to Bristol Temple Meads will arrive / depart Tiverton Parkway and beyond approximately 20 minutes later than normal.

21:45 Penzance to London Paddington “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will arrive / depart Taunton and arrive Reading (set down only) approximately 20 minutes later than normal. Normal arrival time at London Paddington.

Wednesday 

22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth will arrive at Exeter St.David's (set down only) and beyond approximately 28 minutes later than normal.

23:05 Bristol Temple Meads to Exeter St.David's will arrive Exeter St.David's approximately 28 minutes later than normal.

23:45 London Paddington to Penzance “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will arrive Exeter St.David's approximately 28 minutes later than normal. Normal timings departing Exeter St.David's and beyond.

21:45 Penzance to London Paddington “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will depart Exeter St.David's a few minutes later than normal. It will arrive / depart Taunton and arrive Reading (set down only) later than normal. Normal arrival time at London Paddington.

Thursday

22:02 London Paddington to Plymouth will arrive at Newton Abbot (set down only) and Plymouth approximately 8 minutes later than normal.

23:45 London Paddington to Penzance “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will arrive at Plymouth approximately 8 minutes later than normal. Normal timings arriving Liskeard (set down only) and beyond.

21:45 Penzance to London Paddington “Night Riviera” Sleeper Service will depart Newton Abbot approximately 45 minutes later than normal. It will then operate later throughout. Arrival times at Reading (set down only) 04:41 and London Paddington 05:30.

22:20 Gunnislake to Exeter St.David's will arrive at Exeter St.David's approximately 23 minutes later than normal.

23:20 Paignton to Exeter St.David's will terminate at Newton Abbot.

Friday

00:01 Paignton to Exeter St.David's will arrive / depart Exeter St.Thomas and Exeter St.David's approximately 25 minutes later than normal.

04:58 Exeter St.David's to Paignton will arrive / depart Exeter St.Thomas and Starcross 5 minutes later than normal. It will arrive / depart Dawlish Warren and beyond approximately 8 minutes later than normal.

Check before you travel:
